paragraphs.text:
### Create A XAP JDBC Interpreter

Zeppelin JDBC interpreter enables running SQL queries in notebooks. This section shows how to create a jdbc interpreter connected to a XAP space.

1. In the zeppelin web-ui, go to Zeppelin Interpreter section, and press the +create button
2. Fill the name value and choose jdbc as interpreter group
3. A jdbc paramaters list is opened
4. Set default.driver value to com.j_spaces.jdbc.driver.GDriver
5. Set default.url value to jdbc:gigaspaces:url:jini://\*/\*/\{name-of-space-to-connect\}
6. Save
7. Done! Now you can create a paragraph bound to XAP jdbc interpreter and run queries on the space

msg.data:
Create A XAP JDBC Interpreter

Zeppelin JDBC interpreter enables running SQL queries in notebooks. This section shows how to create a jdbc interpreter connected to a XAP space.

  1. In the zeppelin web-ui, go to Zeppelin Interpreter section, and press the +create button
  2. Fill the name value and choose jdbc as interpreter group
  3. A jdbc paramaters list is opened
  4. Set default.driver value to com.j_spaces.jdbc.driver.GDriver
  5. Set default.url value to jdbc:gigaspaces:url:jini://*/*/{name-of-space-to-connect}
  6. Save
  7. Done! Now you can create a paragraph bound to XAP jdbc interpreter and run queries on the space
